DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate effect non-dissecting inferior rectus sheath primary cesarean delivery post-operative hemoglobin post-operative pain control measure VAS score opioid anesthesia use first 72 hour post-op .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Non-Dissection Inferior Rectus Sheath Intraoperative Blood Loss
DOC.criteria: Patients must 18 year old well willing able provide inform consent Patients undergo schedule nonscheduled , nonurgent nonscheduled urgent ( delivery within 30 minute decision surgical delivery ) Cesarean delivery > 35 week gestational age , Patients expect receive Pfannenstiel incision Patients viable singleton intrauterine pregnancy Patients fetus cephalic presentation Patients young 18 year , Patients unable unwilling provide inform consent , Patients illiterate , Patients nonEnglish speaking reading , Patients University Hospital employee Patients medical nursing student school affiliate University Hospital Multifetal gestation ( > 1 intrauterine pregnancy ) , Patients BMI > 40 kg/m^2 Patients suspect placenta accreta placenta previa Patients prior Cesarean delivery Patient undergo emergent cesarean delivery ( delivery within 10 minute decision surgical delivery ) Patients require vertical skin incision , Maylard Cherney incision Patients history significant pelvic adhesive disease , determine prior operative report Patients fetus noncephalic presentation Patients pregestational gestational diabetes mellitus Patients estimate fetal weight > 5000 gram Patients estimate fetal weight < 10 % gestational age Patients require general anesthetic Patients chronic pain medication Patients history drug abuse
